doc.previous: A bivariate quadratic function is a second degree polynomial of the form
doc.after: where A B C D and E are fixed coefficients and F is the constant term Such a function describes a quadratic surface Setting equal to zero describes the intersection of the surface with the plane which is a locus of points equivalent to a conic section
